note: Direct mapping option for <mods:titleInfo>. Use for the main title value, including leading articles and subtitles. (Non-sort articles should be handled via the application indexing logic.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:titleInfo>. Use for a title that has an existing IRI (e.g. uniform title).
Direct mapping option for <mods:titleInfo>. Use for translated or alternative titles.

Direct mapping option for <mods:name>. The mapping allows for the use of any term from the MARC Code List for Relators. For example, Author. Value is an IRI from a controlled vocabulary (like Library of Congress Name Authority File).

Direct mapping option for <mods:name>. The mapping allows for the use of any term from the MARC Code List for Relators. For example, Author. Value is text from a controlled vocabulary (like Library of Congress Name Authority File).
Direct mapping option for <mods:name>. Use for value when known to be creator but role is not specified.
Direct mapping option for <mods:name>. Use for value when known to be creator but role is not specified.
Direct mapping option for <mods:name>. Use for value when known to be contributor but role is not specified.
Direct mapping option for <mods:name>. Use for value when known to be contributor but role is not specified.
Direct mapping option for <mods:typeOfResource>. Use with a type from a controlled vocabulary (such as the LoC ​Resource Types Scheme​ or ​DCMI Type Vocabulary​).
Direct mapping option for <mods:genre>. Use with a genre term from a controlled vocabulary, or a local term.
Direct mapping option for <mods:genre>. Use with a genre term from a controlled vocabulary, or a local term.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use for edition statements typically found in <mods:edition>.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the date of creation (<mods:dateCreated>) for the object, formatted as an EDTF​ string.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent an unspecified type of date (<mods:dateOther>) for the object, formatted as an ​EDTF string.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the date of issuance (<mods:dateIssued>) for the object, formatted as an ​EDTF string.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the date of copyright (<mods:copyrightDate>) for the object, formatted as an EDTF​ string.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the place of distribution, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the place of distribution, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the agent responsible for the manufacture of the item.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the agent responsible for the manufacture of the item.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the place of manufacture, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the place of manufacture, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the agent responsible for the manufacture of the item.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the agent responsible for the manufacture of the item.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the agent responsible for the publication or any other general origination event.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the agent responsible for the publication or any other general origination event.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the agent responsible for the production of the item.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the agent responsible for the production of the item.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the place of production, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the place of production, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the place of publication, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to represent the place of publication, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as TGN or GeoNames.

Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to describe the frequency of publication, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as LoC's ​Publication Frequencies Scheme​. (Lexical alias: rdau:frequency.en)

Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to describe the frequency of publication, preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as LoC's ​Publication Frequencies Scheme​. (Lexical alias: rdau:frequency.en)
Direct mapping option for <mods:originInfo>. Use to indicate an inferred date.
Direct mapping option for <mods:language>. The language of the resource. Preference is to use a value from a controlled vocabulary, such as ​ISO 639-2​.
Direct mapping option for <mods:physicalDescription>. Use to represent MIME data typically found in <mods:internetMediaType>.

Direct mapping option for <mods:physicalDescription>. Use to represent the physical form or medium of material for a resource (<mods:form>), preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as the Library of Congress TGMII or LCGFT.

Direct mapping option for <mods:physicalDescription>. Use to represent the physical form or medium of material for a resource (<mods:form>), preferably using a controlled vocabulary such as the Library of Congress TGMII or LCGFT.

Direct mapping option for <mods:physicalDescription>. Use to represent the method by which the resource became digital form (<mods:digitalOrigin>). (This predicate has been proposed, but not implemented.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:physicalDescription>. Use to represent the extent of a resource (<mods:extent>). (Lexical alias: rdau:extent.en)

Direct mapping option for <mods:physicalDescription>. Use to represent notes about a resource (<mods:note>). @type attribute values for should be precede the element value with a semicolon+space separator.
Direct mapping option for <mods:abstract>. Use to represent an abstract (<mods:abstract>) for the object.
Direct mapping option for <mods:tableOfContents>. Use to represent table of contents information (<mods:tableOfContents>).
Direct mapping option for <mods:tableOfContents>. Use to represent table of contents information (<mods:tableOfContents>).
Direct mapping option for <mods:targetAudience>. Use for a target audience values pulled from the Library of Congress ​Target Audience Scheme.​
Direct mapping option for <mods:note>. Use for the note value.
Direct mapping option for <mods:subject>. Use for name and topical subjects. Use of an IRI from a controlled subject vocabulary is preferred over a literal value.
Direct mapping option for <mods:subject>. Use for name and topical subjects. Use of an IRI from a controlled subject vocabulary is preferred over a literal value.
Direct mapping option for <mods:subject>. Use for geographic subjects. Use of an IRI from a controlled vocabulary is preferred over a literal value.

Direct mapping option for <mods:subject>. Use for geographic subjects. Use of an IRI from a controlled vocabulary is preferred over a literal value. Coordinate values should be formatted as a ​DCMI Point​ or a ​DCMI Box.​
Direct mapping option for <mods:subject>. Use for temporal subjects. Numeric values should formatted using ​EDTF​.
Direct mapping option for <mods:subject>. Use for <mods:cartographic><mods:projection> values. (Lexical alias: rdau:projectionOfCartographicContent.en)
Direct mapping option for <mods:subject>. Use for ​<mods:cartographic><mods:scale> values. (Lexical alias: rdau:scale.en)
Direct mapping option for <mods:classification>. Use for values from Dewey Decimal Classification.
Direct mapping option for <mods:classification>. Use for values from Library of Congress Classification.

Direct mapping option for <mods:classification>. The mapping allows for the use of any designator/code from the Library of Congress ​Classification Schemes. For example, Universal decimal classification.
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use for the title of the archival or bibliographic series the item belongs to.
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use for the title of the archival subseries the item belongs to.
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to link to an alternate version of the item.
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use for the physical/source collection the item belongs to, if the value is a string literal.
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use for the physical/source collection the item belongs to, if the value is an IRI.
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to indicate the administrative or primary digital collection the item belongs to.
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use for the name of the event the item was produced as part of.

Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use for an identifier corresponding to a parent item that the item being described belongs to. Any identifier from the Library of Congress ​Standard Identifier Schemes​ may be used. For example, DOI.
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to indicate the archival series to which the item belongs. (This predicate has been proposed, but not implemented.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to indicate the archival series to which the item belongs. (This predicate has been proposed, but not implemented.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to indicate the digital collection the item belongs to.
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to indicate the IRI for a parent item that the item being described belongs to. (Lexical alias: rdau:containedIn.en)
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to indicate the title or citation for a parent item that the item being described belongs to. (Lexical alias: rdau:containedIn.en)
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to indicate the IRI of a constituent item. (Lexical alias: rdau:containerOf.en)
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use to indicate the title or citation of a constituent item. (Lexical alias: rdau:containerOf.en)
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use for ending page number.
Direct mapping option for <mods:relatedItem>. Use for starting page number.
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. For primary system identifier (ARK, PID, Handle, UUID, etc.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. For primary system identifier (ARK, PID, Handle, UUID, etc.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for any IRI identifiers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for ​Library of Congress Control Numbers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for ​International Standard Book Numbers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for ​International Standard Serial Numbers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for Digital Object Identifier (DOIs)
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for Digital Object Identifier (DOIs)
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for local identifiers.
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for local identifiers including local call numbers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for ​International Standard Music Number identifiers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for Handle system identifiers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for Handle system identifiers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for ​International Standard Recording Code identifiers
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for accession numbers. (This predicate has been proposed, but not implemented.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for legacy accession numbers. (This predicate has been proposed, but not implemented.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:identifier>. Use for local barcodes. (This predicate has been proposed, but not implemented.)
Direct mapping option for <mods:location>. Use for <mods:subLocation> values.
Direct mapping option for <mods:location>. The URL where the digital object can be found, along with contextual metadata.
Direct mapping option for <mods:location>. The URL of the digital object's primary binary file.
Direct mapping option for <mods:location>. The URL where a binary preview image of the object can be found.

Direct mapping option for <mods:location>. Use for <mods:shelfLocator> values. Append values for <mods:enumerationAndChronology> to the end of the literal. (This predicate has been proposed, but not implemented.)

Direct mapping option for <mods:location>. Use for <mods:physicalLocation> values, preferably using an IRI for the organization from a controlled vocabulary such as VIAF of Library of Congress Real World Objects.
Direct mapping option for <mods:location>. Use for <mods:physicalLocation> values, preferably from a controlled vocabulary.
Direct mapping option for <mods:accessCondition>. For local, free-text rights statements.
Direct mapping option for <mods:accessCondition>. Use to designate the copyright owner for the item.
Direct mapping option for <mods:accessCondition>. Use to designate the copyright owner for the item.
Direct mapping option for <mods:accessCondition>. Use to describe any restrictions on access.
Direct mapping option for <mods:accessCondition>. Use to describe any restrictions on access.
Direct mapping option for <mods:accessCondition>. This would be for IRIs such as those from rightsstatement.org
Direct mapping option for <mods:recordInfo>. The most recent change date of the metadata record.
Direct mapping option for <mods:recordInfo>. The date of creation for the original metadata record (may be different than the date of item creation in the repository).
Direct mapping option for <mods:recordInfo>. The descriptions standard used for cataloging, preferably from a controlled vocabulary such as LoC ​Description Conventions​.
Direct mapping option for <mods:recordInfo>. The language of cataloging, preferably from a controlled vocabulary, such as ​ISO 639-2​.
Direct mapping option for <mods:recordInfo>. The organization responsible for making the metadata record and/or digital object available.
Direct mapping option for <mods:recordInfo>. The organization responsible for making the metadata record and/or digital object available.

Direct mapping option for <mods:recordInfo>. The organization responsible for creating the metadata record. Only used where this value may need to be differentiated from the institution managing the repository.

Direct mapping option for <mods:recordInfo>. The organization responsible for creating the metadata record. Only used where this value may need to be differentiated from the institution managing the repository.
Direct mapping option for <mods:recordInfo>. Information about the origin or provenance of the metadata record.
